title: Matrices: Main Definitions and Classification
description: Solve the following exercises on matrix definitions and classification. Show all your work and provide detailed explanations for each answer.

hints: Remember that a matrix is a rectangular array of numbers arranged in rows and columns.
The size of a matrix is determined by its number of rows (m) and columns (n), written as m × n.
Square matrices have equal number of rows and columns.
Classification depends on the values of the elements and the matrix structure.
solution: ## Solutions to Matrix Definitions and Classification Exercises
### Exercise 1: Matrix Dimensions
**a)** Matrix A has 3 rows and 4 columns, so it is a 3×4 matrix.
**b)** Matrix B has 2 rows and 2 columns, so it is a 2×2 square matrix.
**c)** Matrix C has 4 rows and 1 column, so it is a 4×1 column matrix (column vector).
**d)** Matrix D has 1 row and 3 columns, so it is a 1×3 row matrix (row vector).
### Exercise 2: Matrix Classification
**a)** This is a square matrix (2×2) with all elements equal to 1. It is a scalar matrix (multiple of identity) and also a symmetric matrix.
**b)** This is a 2×3 matrix with mixed positive and negative elements. It is neither square nor symmetric.
**c)** This is a 3×3 square matrix with 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere. This is the identity matrix I₃.
**d)** This is a 2×2 square matrix that equals its transpose. This is a symmetric matrix.
### Exercise 3: Matrix Elements
**a)** The element in the 2nd row, 3rd column is denoted as a₂₃ = 7.
**b)** The element in the 1st row, 1st column is denoted as a₁₁ = 4.
**c)** The element in the 3rd row, 2nd column is denoted as a₃₂ = 9.
### Exercise 4: Matrix Types
**a)** A matrix with all elements equal to zero is called a **zero matrix** or **null matrix**.
**b)** A square matrix with 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere is called an **identity matrix**.
**c)** A matrix that is equal to its transpose is called a **symmetric matrix**.
**d)** A matrix with only one column is called a **column matrix** or **column vector**.
### Exercise 5: Matrix Properties
**a)** A matrix with m rows and n columns has **m × n** elements.
**b)** A square matrix has **equal number of rows and columns**.
**c)** The main diagonal of a matrix consists of elements **aᵢⱼ where i = j**.
**d)** A diagonal matrix has **non-zero elements only on the main diagonal**.
